title.narrative: OUTP 6.1: CP SYSTEMS FOR VIOLENCE, ABUSE

description.narrative: Output 6.1. Increased national capacity to provide access to child protection systems, including welfare and justice services that prevent and respond to violence, exploitation, abuse, and neglect., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 6: Improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect of children.

sector.narrative: ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Ending violence against women and girls
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.1. Increased national capacity to provide access to child protection systems, including welfare and justice services that prevent and respond to violence, exploitation, abuse, and neglect.
